data.text:
In Weimar Republic: Toward stabilization

A new currency, the Rentenmark, was introduced on November 20, 1923, in strictly limited quantities. It was backed by a mortgage on the entire industrial and agricultural resources of the country. The process of stabilization was painful but was pushed through with determination by Hjalmar Schacht, who was made…

In 20th-century international relations: Allied politics and reparations

…a temporary currency called the Rentenmark, and on New Year’s Day 1924 the president of the Bank of England, Montagu Norman, extended a 500,000,000 gold mark credit to back a new German mark. In October 1923, meanwhile, rowdy bands supported by the French occupation began to seize public buildings from…
